VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Configure Payment Options Available on the Checkout Page

Provide an efficient and trusted interface for a buyer to specify their payment details during checkout. In the Payment section of the Checkout page, you can allow a buyer to manually enter payment information or select a stored payment option already defined.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

The Payment section of the Checkout page can show the following options for either standard checkout or line-level independence (LLI) checkout:

Standard checkout:
LLI checkout:
Available stored payments (1)
Payment options that are already saved for the account. You can allow a buyer to manage stored payments in the My Wallet section of the My Account page.
New payment form (2)
Controls for specifying a new payment that's not already saved for the account.
NOTE
By default, B2B Commerce for Visualforce supports only purchase order (PO) payments. You can set up other payment types, including credit cards, bank accounts, and so on.
For a PO payment, you can optionally require that a buyer enters a PO number before they can place the order.
Option to save the new payment (3)
Checkbox for adding the payment details entered on the Checkout page to the account's stored payments.
Billing address (4, with LLI checkout only)
Controls for selecting a billing address from the account's address book.
NOTE These controls appear in the Order Payment section of the Checkout page for only line-level independence (LLI) checkout. For standard checkout, a buyer specifies a billing address in the User Information section of the Checkout page. You can restrict a buyer from entering any new address details, and require them to select from the account's address book.

When a buyer places the order, B2B Commerce for Visualforce creates a transaction payment record from the specified payment details.

To manage the options in the Payment section of the Checkout page:

Complete the steps in Allow a Buyer to Manage Stored Payments on the My Account Page, which describes how to:
Enable stored payments
Require a buyer to enter a PO number for a new PO payment
Optionally, set up payment types other than the default PO. Complete the steps in Set Up Payment Types for Storefront Purchases.
Verify that the appropriate storefront configuration setting is specified.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Checkout (3).
Find the New Order configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Checkout
Configuration	New Order
Page	all
Value	TRUE
IMPORTANT For compatibility with other checkout functionality, always leave this configuration set to TRUE.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
